Class Connect4Column

  • java.lang.Object
    • Connect4Column

  • public class Connect4Column
extends java.lang.Object
    A single column in a Connect 4 game. A column stores a number of individual slots. You should not modify this class, but you will need to use methods within it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connect4Column(Connect4Column column)
      Creates a copy of the given Connect4Column.
      Connect4Column(int height)
      Creates a new Connect4Column with a given height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getIsFull()
      Checks if the column is full.
      int getRowCount()
      Returns the number of rows in the column.
      Connect4Slot getSlot(int i)
      Returns a single Connect4Slot from the column.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4Column

        public Connect4Column(int height)
        Creates a new Connect4Column with a given height. Your agent will not need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of the column.

      • Connect4Column

        public Connect4Column(Connect4Column column)
        Creates a copy of the given Connect4Column. Your agent will not need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • getSlot

        public Connect4Slot getSlot(int i)
        Returns a single Connect4Slot from the column. Your agent WILL need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        i - the Connect4Slot to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the Connect4Slot at that index.

      • getIsFull

        public boolean getIsFull()
        Checks if the column is full. Your agent WILL need to use this method.
        Returns:
        true if the column is full, false otherwise.

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows in the column. Your agent WILL need to use this method.
        Returns:
        the number of rows in the column.
